info.title: Collibra Import API
info.description: The Import API is an efficient way to load large volumes of data into the Collibra Data Governance Center. The API can automatically differentiate between creating and updating data.

tags.name: Import Results
tags.description: Additional information about finished import jobs

post.summary: Starts import from the CSV file in job (asynchronously).
post.description:
Starts import from the CSV file in job (asynchronously).

Request can either accept id of the uploaded file that contains CSV input which should be used for import - or the file itself.

sendNotification.description: Whether job status notification should be sent. The default value is false.

batchSize.description: The batchSize parameter is now deprecated and is ignored during command execution.

simulation.description:
Whether the import should be triggered as a simulation. The default value is false.

If true, the result of the import simulation will be available at the end of the job but no change will be applied to the DGC.

saveResult.description:
Whether the import Result should be persisted or forgotten. The default value is false.

If true, the result of the import simulation will be available at the end of the job but no change will be applied to the DGC.

continueOnError.description:
Whether the import should continue if some of the import commands are invalid or failed to execute. The default value is false.

If true, the valid commands are still committed to the database, which can lead to partial results being stored.

fileId.description:
The id of uploaded file.

NOTE: if this field is used, file should not be set.

file.description:
The file to upload. If set, then also fileName should be provided.

NOTE: if this field is used, fileId should not be set.

fileName.description:
The name of the file to upload. If set, then also file should be provided.

NOTE: if this field is used, fileId should not be set.

deleteFile.description:
Delete the file from the Collibra Platform if the import / synchronization job is successful. The default value is false

NOTE: if the file corresponds to an attachment, the attachment will be deleted.

separator.description: The delimiter character used to separate entries. The default value is ';'.

quote.description: The delimiter character used for quoted entries. The default value is '"'.

escape.description: The delimiter character used to escape separator or quote character. The default value is '\\'.

strictQuotes.description: Whether the characters outside quotes should be ignored. The default value is false.

ignoreLeadingWhitespace.description: Whether whitespace characters before quotes should be ignored. The default value is false.

headerRow.description: Whether the first row of the imported CSV file is the header. The default value is false.

post.summary: Starts import from the Excel file in job (asynchronously).
post.description:
Starts import from the Excel file in job (asynchronously).

Request can either accept id of the uploaded file that contains Excel input which should be used for import - or the file itself.

sendNotification.description: Whether job status notification should be sent. The default value is false.

batchSize.description: The batchSize parameter is now deprecated and is ignored during command execution.

simulation.description:
Whether the import should be triggered as a simulation. The default value is false.

If true, the result of the import simulation will be available at the end of the job but no change will be applied to the DGC.

saveResult.description:
Whether the import Result should be persisted or forgotten. The default value is false.

If true, the result of the import simulation will be available at the end of the job but no change will be applied to the DGC.

continueOnError.description:
Whether the import should continue if some of the import commands are invalid or failed to execute. The default value is false.

If true, the valid commands are still committed to the database, which can lead to partial results being stored.

fileId.description:
The id of uploaded file.

NOTE: if this field is used, file should not be set.

file.description:
The file to upload. If set, then also fileName should be provided.

NOTE: if this field is used, fileId should not be set.

fileName.description:
The name of the file to upload. If set, then also file should be provided.

NOTE: if this field is used, fileId should not be set.

deleteFile.description:
Delete the file from the Collibra Platform if the import / synchronization job is successful. The default value is false

NOTE: if the file corresponds to an attachment, the attachment will be deleted.

sheetName.description:
The name of the Excel sheet.

If the name is null and sheetIndex is null, the first sheet of the workbook will be used for the import.

If the name is null and sheetIndex is not null, the sheet with the index specified by value of sheetIndex will be used for the import.

sheetIndex.description:
The index of the Excel sheet.

If the index is null and sheetName is null, the first sheet of the workbook will be used for the import.

If the index is null and sheetName is not null, the sheet with the name specified by value of sheetName will be used for the import.

headerRow.description: Whether the first row of the imported Excel sheet is the header. The default value is false.

relationsAction.description: Should it replace existing relations or add/update if any during refresh

get.summary: List the errors of a finished import job.
get.description: Returns import errors of a finished import job identified by given jobId. By default a result containing 1000 errors is returned.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The first result to retrieve. If not set (offset = 0), results will be retrieved starting from row 0.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve. If not set (limit = 0), the default limit will be used.

parameters.name: countLimit
parameters.description: Allows to limit the number of elements that will be counted. -1 will count everything and 0 will cause the count to be skipped

get.summary: Retrieve a summary of a finished import job.
get.description: Retrieve a summary of a finished import job.

delete.summary: Removes all cache entries corresponding to the provided synchronization id.
delete.description:
Removes all cache entries corresponding to the provided synchronization id.

The synchronization component is optimized to only execute commands that differ from cycle to cycle. Call this method to clear the command cache and force the execution of all commands in this cycle.

Note: this operation does not stop the tracking of the resources identified by the provided synchronization id. The next synchronization process usingthe same id will still be able to detect resources that should be removed.

parameters.name: synchronizationId
parameters.description: The synchronization id of the operation.

get.summary: Checks whether given synchronization id already exists.
get.description: Checks whether given synchronization id already exists.

parameters.name: synchronizationId
parameters.description: The synchronization id of the operation.

200.description: Returns true if synchronization id already exists, false otherwise.

get.summary: Returns synchronization information matching the given search criteria.
get.description:
Returns synchronization information matching the given search criteria.

Only parameters that are specified in this request and have not null values are used for filtering. All other parameters are ignored.

The returned synchronization information satisfies all constraints that are specified in this search criteria. By default a result containing 1000 synchronization infos is returned.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The first result to retrieve. If not set (offset = 0), results will be retrieved starting from row 0.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve. If not set (limit = 0), the default limit will be used.

parameters.name: countLimit
parameters.description: Allows to limit the number of elements that will be counted. -1 will count everything and 0 will cause the count to be skipped

200.description: The paged response with found synchronization information.

delete.summary: Removes all information about synchronization process corresponding to provided synchronization id.
delete.description:
Removes all information about synchronization process corresponding to provided synchronization id.

This operation stops tracking of synchronization identified by provided synchronization id. The next synchronization process specified with this id will not be able to detect resources that should be removed.

parameters.name: synchronizationId
parameters.description: The synchronization id of the operation.

post.summary: Starts batch synchronization from the CSV file in job (asynchronously).
post.description:
Starts batch synchronization from the CSV file in job (asynchronously).

Request can either accept id of the uploaded file that contains CSV input which should be used for import or the file itself. The input file is treated as a part (batch) of synchronization process. After last batch, finalization (cleanup) process should be called.

parameters.name: synchronizationId
parameters.description: The synchronization id used to distinguish different synchronizations.

sendNotification.description: Whether job status notification should be sent. The default value is false.

batchSize.description: The batchSize parameter is now deprecated and is ignored during command execution.

simulation.description:
Whether the import should be triggered as a simulation. The default value is false.

If true, the result of the import simulation will be available at the end of the job but no change will be applied to the DGC.

saveResult.description:
Whether the import Result should be persisted or forgotten. The default value is false.

If true, the result of the import simulation will be available at the end of the job but no change will be applied to the DGC.

continueOnError.description:
Whether the import should continue if some of the import commands are invalid or failed to execute. The default value is false.

If true, the valid commands are still committed to the database, which can lead to partial results being stored.

fileId.description:
The id of uploaded file.

NOTE: if this field is used, file should not be set.

file.description:
The file to upload. If set, then also fileName should be provided.

NOTE: if this field is used, fileId should not be set.

fileName.description:
The name of the file to upload. If set, then also file should be provided.

NOTE: if this field is used, fileId should not be set.

deleteFile.description:
Whether the file should be deleted after the synchronization job is finished, regardless of the result. The default value is false.

NOTE: if the file corresponds to an attachment, the attachment will be deleted.

separator.description: The delimiter character used to separate entries. The default value is ';'.

quote.description: The delimiter character used for quoted entries. The default value is '"'.

escape.description: The delimiter character used to escape separator or quote character. The default value is '\\'.

strictQuotes.description: Whether the characters outside quotes should be ignored. The default value is false.

ignoreLeadingWhitespace.description: Whether whitespace characters before quotes should be ignored. The default value is false.

headerRow.description: Whether the first row of the synchronized CSV file is the header. The default value is false.

post.description:
Starts synchronization finalization in job (asynchronously).

Note that while the only mandatory parameter is synchronizationId, requests that omit all optional parameters fail because the multipart-based setup requires at least one part to be present in the body. To meet this requirement and still use all the default values, you can pass a dummy part, for example -F 'foo=bar' if using curl.

parameters.name: synchronizationId
parameters.description: The synchronization ID used to distinguish different synchronizations.

sendNotification.description: Whether job status notification should be sent. The default value is false.

batchSize.description: The batchSize parameter is now deprecated and is ignored during command execution.

simulation.description:
Whether the import should be triggered as a simulation. The default value is false.

If true, the result of the import simulation will be available at the end of the job but no change will be applied to the DGC.

saveResult.description:
Whether the import Result should be persisted or forgotten. The default value is false.

If true, the result of the import simulation will be available at the end of the job but no change will be applied to the DGC.

continueOnError.description:
Whether the import should continue if some of the import commands are invalid or failed to execute. The default value is false.

If true, the valid commands are still committed to the database, which can lead to partial results being stored.

finalizationStrategy.description:
The synchronization finalization strategy used in the clean up action. This determines whether to remove or change the status of resources that no longer exist in the external system.
Possible values are `REMOVE_RESOURCES` or `CHANGE_STATUS`.
When you select `CHANGE_STATUS`, you must also provide a value for `missingAssetStatusId`.

missingAssetStatusId.description: If finalizationStrategy is set to `CHANGE_STATUS` then this parameter determines the new status ID for resources that no longer exist in the external system.

additionalProperties.description:
If you have set `finalizationStrategy` to `CHANGE_STATUS`, the status ID for the resources that no longer exist in the external system.

NOTE: This parameter must be declared with an 'application/json' content type.

DEPRECATED: This parameter is deprecated and will be removed in the future. Please, use missingAssetStatusId.

finalizationParameters.description:
If you have set `finalizationStrategy` to `CHANGE_STATUS`, the status ID for the resources that no longer exist in the external system.

NOTE: This parameter must be declared with an 'application/json' content type.

DEPRECATED: This parameter is deprecated and will be removed in the future. Please, use missingAssetStatusId.

id.description: The id of the represented object (entity).

createdBy.description: The id of the user that created this resource.

createdOn.description: The timestamp (in UTC time standard) of the creation of this resource.

lastModifiedBy.description: The id of the user who modified this resource the last time.

lastModifiedOn.description: The timestamp (in UTC time standard) of the last modification of this resource.

system.description: Whether this is a system resource or not.

resourceType.description: The type of this resource, i.e. [Community, Asset, Domain, Attribute, Relation, WorkflowInstance].

userId.description: The ID of the user that initiated this job.

progressPercentage.description: The progress percentage of the job.

cancelable.description: Whether this job is cancelable or not. If set to false it will not be possible to cancel the job once submitted.

startDate.description: The start date of the job.

endDate.description: The end date of the job.

Job.description: Represents a job. Job is a single atomic task that is to be performed asynchronously

batchSize.description: The batchSize parameter is now deprecated and is ignored during command execution.

simulation.description:
Whether the import should be triggered as a simulation. The default value is false.

If true, the result of the import simulation will be available at the end of the job but no change will be applied to the DGC.

saveResult.description:
Whether the import Result should be persisted or forgotten. The default value is false.

If true, the result of the import simulation will be available at the end of the job but no change will be applied to the DGC.

continueOnError.description:
Whether the import should continue if some of the import commands are invalid or failed to execute. The default value is false.

If true, the valid commands are still committed to the database, which can lead to partial results being stored.

fileId.description:
The id of uploaded file.

NOTE: if this field is used, file should not be set.

file.description:
The file to upload. If set, then also fileName should be provided.

NOTE: if this field is used, fileId should not be set.

fileName.description:
The name of the file to upload. If set, then also file should be provided.

NOTE: if this field is used, fileId should not be set.

deleteFile.description:
Delete the file from the Collibra Platform if the import / synchronization job is successful. The default value is false

NOTE: if the file corresponds to an attachment, the attachment will be deleted.

ImportJsonInJobRequest.description: The request defining import call properties from a JSON file.

indices.description: Indices of the import command in the input file.

items.description: Indices of the import command in the input file.

ImportCommandReference.description: A reference to the import command.

limit.description: The maximum number of results to be returned.
The maximum number of results to be returned.

CategoryReference.description: The category reference, for example AssetType or AttributeType.

resourceTypes.description: A list of the resource type import summary.

errorsCount.description: The total number of errors the occurred during the import.

ImportSummary.description: Represents a summary report of the import job results.

subcategories.description: A detailed summary of the number of resources that have been affected by the import job. This can be empty for some resource types, f.e. Mapping.

ResourceTypeSummary.description: An import summary results for a particular resource type.

SubcategorySummary.description: An import summary results for a particular resource category.

limit.description: The maximum number of results to be returned.

FindSynchronizationRequest.description: The search criteria for synchronization information. Only parameters that are specified in this request and have not null values are used for filtering. All other parameters are ignored. The returned synchronization information satisfy all constraints that are specified in this search criteria. By default a result containing 1000 synchronization infos is returned.

sendNotification.description: Whether job status notification should be sent. The default value is false.

batchSize.description: The batchSize parameter is now deprecated and is ignored during command execution.

simulation.description:
Whether the import should be triggered as a simulation. The default value is false.

If true, the result of the import simulation will be available at the end of the job but no change will be applied to the DGC.

saveResult.description:
Whether the import Result should be persisted or forgotten. The default value is false.

If true, the result of the import simulation will be available at the end of the job but no change will be applied to the DGC.

continueOnError.description:
Whether the import should continue if some of the import commands are invalid or failed to execute. The default value is false.

If true, the valid commands are still committed to the database, which can lead to partial results being stored.

fileId.description:
The id of uploaded file.

NOTE: if this field is used, file should not be set.

file.description:
The file to upload. If set, then also fileName should be provided.

NOTE: if this field is used, fileId should not be set.

fileName.description:
The name of the file to upload. If set, then also file should be provided.

NOTE: if this field is used, fileId should not be set.

deleteFile.description:
Whether the file should be deleted after the synchronization job is finished, regardless of the result. The default value is false.

NOTE: if the file corresponds to an attachment, the attachment will be deleted.

separator.description: The delimiter character used to separate entries. The default value is ';'.

quote.description: The delimiter character used for quoted entries. The default value is '"'.

escape.description: The delimiter character used to escape separator or quote character. The default value is '\\'.

strictQuotes.description: Whether the characters outside quotes should be ignored. The default value is false.

ignoreLeadingWhitespace.description: Whether whitespace characters before quotes should be ignored. The default value is false.

headerRow.description: Whether the first row of the synchronized CSV file is the header. The default value is false.

SynchronizationBatchCsvInJobRequest.description: The request defining batch synchronization call properties from a CSV file.

sendNotification.description: Whether job status notification should be sent. The default value is false.

batchSize.description: The batchSize parameter is now deprecated and is ignored during command execution.

simulation.description:
Whether the import should be triggered as a simulation. The default value is false.

If true, the result of the import simulation will be available at the end of the job but no change will be applied to the DGC.

saveResult.description:

If true, the result of the import simulation will be available at the end of the job but no change will be applied to the DGC.

continueOnError.description:
Whether the import should continue if some of the import commands are invalid or failed to execute. The default value is false.

If true, the valid commands are still committed to the database, which can lead to partial results being stored.

fileId.description:
The id of uploaded file.

NOTE: if this field is used, file should not be set.

file.description:
The file to upload. If set, then also fileName should be provided.

NOTE: if this field is used, fileId should not be set.

fileName.description:
The name of the file to upload. If set, then also file should be provided.

NOTE: if this field is used, fileId should not be set.

deleteFile.description:
Whether the file should be deleted after the synchronization job is finished, regardless of the result. The default value is false.

NOTE: if the file corresponds to an attachment, the attachment will be deleted.

sheetName.description:
The name of the Excel sheet.

If the name is null and sheetIndex is null, the first sheet of the workbook will be used for the synchronization.

If the name is null and sheetIndex is not null, the sheet with the index specified by value of sheetIndex will be used for the synchronization.

sheetIndex.description:
The index of the Excel sheet.

If the index is null and sheetName is null, the first sheet of the workbook will be used for the synchronization.

If the index is null and sheetName is not null, the sheet with the name specified by value of sheetName will be used for the synchronization.

headerRow.description: Whether the first row of the synchronized Excel file is the header. The default value is false.

finalizationStrategy.description:
The synchronization finalization strategy used in the clean up action. This determines whether to remove or change the status of resources that no longer exist in the external system.
Possible values are `REMOVE_RESOURCES` or `CHANGE_STATUS`.
When you select `CHANGE_STATUS`, you must also provide a value for `missingAssetStatusId`.

missingAssetStatusId.description: If finalizationStrategy is set to `CHANGE_STATUS` then this parameter determines the new status ID for resources that no longer exist in the external system.

additionalProperties.description:
If you have set `finalizationStrategy` to `CHANGE_STATUS`, the status ID for the resources that no longer exist in the external system.

NOTE: This parameter must be declared with an 'application/json' content type.

DEPRECATED: This parameter is deprecated and will be removed in the future. Please, use missingAssetStatusId.

finalizationParameters.description:
If you have set `finalizationStrategy` to `CHANGE_STATUS`, the status ID for the resources that no longer exist in the external system.

NOTE: This parameter must be declared with an 'application/json' content type.

DEPRECATED: This parameter is deprecated and will be removed in the future. Please, use missingAssetStatusId.

SynchronizationFinalizationRequest.description: The request defining synchronization finalization call properties.
